indications: Indications see notes above and under Dose
name: GLUCAGON
cautions:
Cautions 
(From 6.1.4 Treatment of hypoglycaemia: British National Formulary)
6.1.4 Treatment of hypoglycaemia, insulinoma, glucagonoma; ineffective
in chronic hypoglycaemia, starvation, and adrenal insufficiency
side-effects:
Side-effects nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, hypokalaemia,
hypotension, rarely hypersensitivity reactions
doses:
Insulin-induced hypoglycaemia, by subcutaneous, intramuscular, or intravenous
injection, adult and child over 8 years (or body-weight over 25 kg), 1 mg; child under 8 years (or body-weight under 25 kg),
500 micrograms; if no response within 10 minutes intravenous glucose must be given
Beta-blocker poisoning, see Emergency Treatment of Poisoning

1 unit of glucagon = 1 mg
of glucagon
